column1: rev. donald f. kelly| green island rev. donald f. kelly
column3: former pastor of st. josephs church in green island
column6: 2015 at the teresian house in albany. born in green island
column7: son of the late eugene and mildred van. buren kelly
column8: he was a graduate of heatly high school in green island and niagara university. he served in the u. s. army during the korean war. father don was ordained on may 25
column9: 1963 by bishop scully at the cathedral of the immaculate conception in albany. he served in many parishes
column14: st. monicas in johnsonville and returned to his hometown of green island to serve as pastor of st. josephs church for nine years
column15: retiring 2006. father was an accomplished pianist who never met a piano he didnt like. he also enjoyed his membership in the green island senior citizens
column16: especially the lunches and he always looked forward to his daily visits with his fellow members of the liars club at the river park in green island. he is the beloved brother of john (mary) kelly of guilderland
column19: mary m. kelly of carson city
column22: william and robert kelly. father don is also survived by many loving nieces and nephews. calling hours for father kelly will be on thursday
column24: 2015 from 4 to 7 p. m. at the mc. nulty funeral home
column26: green island. the funeral liturgy will be celebrated on friday
column28: 2015 at immaculate heart of mary church in watervliet at 11:00 a. m. with the most reverend edward b. scharfenberger
column30: bishop of albany as the principal celebrant. burial with full military honors will take place on monday
column31: june 22nd at 10:00 a. m. at saratoga national cemetery. the funeral cortege will assemble inside the gate at 9:45 a. m. due to floral restrictions at the cemetery
column32: the family has requested that donations be made in father dons memory to the teresian house
